org.opends.sdk.schema.syntaxes
Class AuthPasswordSyntax

java.lang.Object
  org.opends.sdk.schema.syntaxes.AuthPasswordSyntax
All Implemented Interfaces:
SyntaxImplementation
public class AuthPasswordSyntax
extends Object

This class defines the auth password attribute syntax, which is defined in RFC 3112 and is used to hold authentication information. Only equality matching will be allowed by default.

valueIsAcceptable

public boolean valueIsAcceptable(Schema schema,
                                 ByteSequence value,
                                 org.opends.messages.MessageBuilder invalidReason)
Description copied from interface: SyntaxImplementation
Indicates whether the provided value is acceptable for use in an attribute with this syntax. If it is not, then the reason may be appended to the provided buffer.

Parameters:
schema - The schema in which this syntax is defined.
value - The value for which to make the determination.
invalidReason - The buffer to which the invalid reason should be appended.
Returns:
true if the provided value is acceptable for use with this syntax, or false if not.

decodeAuthPassword

public static StringBuilder[] decodeAuthPassword(String authPasswordValue)
                                          throws DecodeException
Decodes the provided authentication password value into its component parts.

Parameters:
authPasswordValue - The authentication password value to be decoded.
Returns:
A three-element array, containing the scheme, authInfo, and authValue components of the given string, in that order.
Throws:
DecodeException - If a problem is encountered while attempting to decode the value.

isEncoded

public static boolean isEncoded(ByteSequence value)
Indicates whether the provided value is encoded using the auth password syntax.

Parameters:
value - The value for which to make the determination.
Returns:
true if the value appears to be encoded using the auth password syntax, or false if not.

isBEREncodingRequired

public boolean isBEREncodingRequired()
Description copied from interface: SyntaxImplementation
Indicates whether this attribute syntax requires that values must be encoded using the Basic Encoding Rules (BER) used by X.500 directories and always include the binary attribute description option.

Specified by:
isBEREncodingRequired in interface SyntaxImplementation
Returns:
true this attribute syntax requires that values must be BER encoded and always include the binary attribute description option, or false if not.
See Also:
RFC 4522 - Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP): The Binary Encoding Option
